page.title: 16Woods at Everleigh
page.content: Throughout the area there are numerous copses both conferous and deciduous. One copse of note is that known locally in Everleigh as Alma Clump. This clump of trees was laid out by Sir John Astley on his return from the Battle of Alma in 1854 in the Crimean War. The shape of the copse is a replica of the defensive position of the Scots Fusilier Guards at the Battle of Alma. Some of the aforrested land provides cover for troops in training in the area and homes for Pheasants, Partridge and Deer.
